summary: The 'Sustaining Our Democracy Act' (S. 2588) establishes the Democracy Advancement and Innovation Program, providing funds to states for improving election administration and voter access. Key provisions include allocating funds for upgrading voting equipment, voter outreach, and cybersecurity; recruiting and training election officials; and increasing access for underserved communities. The bill also establishes an Office of Democracy Advancement and Innovation to oversee the program and a State Election Assistance and Innovation Trust Fund. It outlines requirements for state plans, prohibitions on fund use, and state-based complaint procedures. The bill is set to take effect for fiscal year 2026.
